None of this has anything to do with the fact that our state faced some of the most severe storms ever on that day. The boys were unfortunate to obviously be a tragedy of the circumstances. What needs to happen, instead of trying to educate more youngsters, is passing a law to make it mandatory that boats have gps' on them so at least the coast guard or whomever can have a place to begin a search and rescue mission. So sad all around- I pray these families to find peace.

Some of you are ridiculous. If you've never served and don't understand the meaning of the term """"military bearing"""" then stfu. This isn't a democratic institution, the rules and regulations exist to keep the discipline in the ranks and ultimately to keep people alive. Sign that dotted line and raise your right hand if you want to chime in your opinion on the military. Otherwise go back to your civilian life and thank a servicemember for putting up with the lifestyle that you never chose.

Rolling my eyes at all the 'horrified' & 'snowflake' comments. 10tv put horrified in their post.. nowhere in the story did it say the new York couple was 'horrified' to find the weapon. They didn't order a rifle, they received a rifle. You don't simply slap a 'return to sender' sticker on it and walk away... you do what they did and call police to take possession of it and get it where it needs to go. Like it or not, there are laws concerning shipping weapons. Maybe read the story before you go off on a 'libtard snowflake' rant.
